intro: Erycibe lateraliflora, commonly known as the lateral-flowered erycibe, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with broad, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in complex structures called cyathia, which are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Erycibe lateraliflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant, colorful blooms.
